programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: Take a look at highlights from the 1985 MLB All-Star Game. The American League only scored one run on a sacrifice fly from George Brett. The National League scored six runs and NL pitcher LaMarr Hoyt won MVP.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki makes history in 2007 by hitting the first-ever inside-the-park home run during an All-Star Game. He was rewarded MVP for going 3-for-3 at the plate and collecting two RBIs in an American League victory, 5-4.

programme.desc: Jeff McNeil's second homer of the game gives the Mets an epic 6-5 Subway Series victory on July 4th.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: In his 19th and final All-Star Game, Cal Ripken Jr. hits a home run to lead the American League to a 4-1 victory over the National League. The 2001 All-Star Game was also the final game for Padres right fielder Tony Gwynn.

programme.title: Will Manny Feature
programme.desc: Last year, veteran attackman Will Manny was cast off by the Whipsnakes. TLN followed him to Boston Cannons training camp before the 2025 season to highlight his return to the field — 635 days after his last appearance in a PLL game. Watch him prepare for camp at UAlbany, battle with the fourth-overall pick for a spot on the game day roster and, ultimately, help lift the Cannons to victory.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Princeton, N.J. to get to know the fourth-overall pick in the 2025 PLL Draft: Coulter Mackesy. In this episode of THROUGH X, Mackesy sheds light on his highly touted squash background, explains how he found his one-of-a-kind shooting stroke, and discusses his desire to lead the Princeton Tigers back to an NCAA Championship before turning pro

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2023 | Event #4 $10K No-Limit Hold'em
programme.desc: Watch the Event #4: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table at the 2023 Poker Masters here.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Who Is She?
programme.desc: Struggling to find love and acceptance, a woman suffering from multiple personality disorder wreaks havoc on the lives of everyone she encounters.

programme.title: Bars
programme.desc: A woman's idyllic world comes crashing down when she's sentenced to life in prison for a crime she didn't commit. She soon finds strength and solace among a group of tight-knit inmates known as the Pretty Girls.

programme.title: Vampire Genesis
programme.desc: Half-alien Teh'a flees across galaxies, hunted by a race of parasitic rulers disguised as Earth's vampires. With rebels by her side, she seeks a legendary creature: the first vampire, powerful enough to end their reign of terror.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Well-known rapper Poetic Rhymes goes to jail after a misunderstanding at a bar. He encounters an unusual cell mate that takes control of his mind. After being released from prison, his family notices the changes the hard way.

programme.title: Wannabe a Star
programme.desc: This time, everything is upgraded. New students, new location and new problems for Dr. Cool. Lardel has hired a spy to watch him, his hustle is beginning to unravel, and family is becoming uneasy, and his heart is feeling conviction.

programme.title: Liquid Dreams
programme.desc: The Dawkins brothers, navigating new careers and relationships, find their bond tested when a wild night of partying sets off a chain of events. Years after their initial adventures, they face fresh challenges that threaten to tear them apart.

programme.title: Smash and Dash
programme.desc: Clarence, a Chef from Chicago, is very passionate about two things, food and love. After being jilted at the altar, Clarence's friends Lakeith and Buddy, immediately urge him to get back into the dating pool, but under one condition, Clarence needs to hook up with as many women as he possibly can through a dating app without falling in love.

programme.title: Who's Watching Us
programme.desc: When Ruth is hired to babysit for the Harris family, she and the kids find out that someone else is watching them closely. Ruth and Jasmine must fight to protect themselves and her little brother Micah.

programme.title: Liquid Dreams
programme.desc: The Dawkins brothers, navigating new careers and relationships, find their bond tested when a wild night of partying sets off a chain of events. Years after their initial adventures, they face fresh challenges that threaten to tear them apart.

programme.title: The Undeserving
programme.desc: An assassin who botches a hit and takes out the wrong mark finds herself on the run with a target on her back from the entire underworld.

programme.title: Toxic King
programme.desc: Keeng is searching for love in all the wrong places. After years of trouble relationships, he decides to just be a playboy and become a "serial love hopper" that is until he reunites with Zuri, a college friend who he has always had a crush on.

programme.title: Apex
programme.desc: A special ops team enters a secret bunker called Hades to retrieve missing scientists, only to uncover a horror far beyond what they expected.

programme.title: The Price of Fame
programme.desc: Cassie meets a charming interviewer and enters the world of fame, relying on her best friend as she navigates its glamorous but ruthless side.

programme.title: The Wrong Man
programme.desc: After a devastating loss, a widowed mother seeks to provide stability for her two children and find new love. But love is not always what it seems.

programme.title: Dreamer on Dreamer 2
programme.desc: Derrick attempts to break it off with his side-chick Keisha, but she thought she was his one and only. That is until she finds out about his fiancé Crystal. To get revenge, Keisha decides to befriend Crystal.

programme.title: Induced
programme.desc: An expectant couple heads to a remote cabin to have a natural childbirth, but comes under attack from a predatory midwife who will stop at nothing to snatch their unborn child from them.

programme.title: Trapped in the Game
programme.desc: Polo is a young desperate hustler looking to make some quick cash. However, the only way he knows how to make cash quickly, is pimping out young women with the help of his crew. When of his crew starts taking girls off the street, the heat threatens to bring down his whole operation.

programme.title: Surviving the Storm
programme.desc: An advanced-stage breast cancer diagnosis for a 28-year-old single mom rallies her estranged sisters together to confront their family's dark past.

programme.title: She Time
programme.desc: Bored with her life and fading marriage, a woman encounters an old acquaintance on a girls’ night out and begins an affair with him.

programme.title: SistAhood
programme.desc: A woman who returns home to Georgia to be closer to loved ones finds a different reality, one that she gets through with her circle of girlfriends.

programme.title: SistAhood 2: Calling All Lovers
programme.desc: A group of girlfriends work to improve themselves and each other, but grudges and old secrets will test the future of their sisterhood.

programme.title: Killer Zaddy
programme.desc: A college student meets the stable, successful man of her dreams, only for her to realize her dreams come at a price.

programme.title: Hidden Agenda
programme.desc: When a popular football star dies after an after party, a woman goes on the hunt to find his killer.

programme.title: Priceless: The Score
programme.desc: After starting their new record label, Donica Blair and Shequell Harris have entered a dangerous arena full of guns, lies, and deceit. Now they are racing against time to right their wrongs and save their own lives before they are next in a string of murders. Meanwhile their partner Seven, has fallen victim to the deadliest of them all; the Black widow.

programme.title: Runway of Shadows
programme.desc: Sisters Ivy and Zara are separated at a very young age due to their father's deceit. When Ivy and Zara unexpectedly cross paths at a prestigious runway show, the stage it set for a series of mysterious and unsettling events.

programme.title: The Isiah Factor Uncensored

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Guiron" (1969) Science fiction. Flying turtle Gamera spins to the far side of the sun and meets a pointy-headed monster and women who like brains. With Nobuhiro Kashima, Christopher Murphy, Miyuki Akiyama.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Zigra" (1971) Science fiction. The big dual-exhaust turtle chucks a boulder onto the razor-sharp back of monster Zigra.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Fugitive Alien" (1986) Science fiction. Wolf Raiders from Valnastar attack Earth; one, wanted for treason, becomes a space loner named Ken. With Tatsuya Azuma, Miyuki Tanigawa, Joe Shishido.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.desc: The week begins with a pop challenge at a local Diner. The contestants must answer trivia questions.

programme.desc: The contestants will now be competing as singles! In addition, this week there's a double Red Line.

programme.title: The Biggest Loser US

programme.title: The Biggest Loser US

programme.title: The Biggest Loser US

programme.desc: One contestant from each team has their own lane on a giant treadmill hovering over a pool of water.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Amityville: Dollhouse
programme.desc: A miniature dollhouse replica of an infamous haunted house gifted to a little girl unleashes a full-sized, terrifying evil upon her unprepared family.

programme.title: Amityville: It's About Time
programme.desc: After a widowed father brings home a mysterious antique clock, sinister incidents begin to occur in his house, and throughout the neighborhood.

programme.title: Phantasm: Ravager
programme.desc: The phantasm nightmare comes to an end as reality blurs for a hero in search of his friend and out to vanquish a villain who can be two places at once

programme.title: Road Games
programme.desc: A laid-back American truck driver in Australia starts to suspect that a man driving a green van killed young women along his route.

programme.title: Summer of 84
programme.desc: Teenager Davey Armstrong is a conspiracy theorist who begins to suspect that a neighboring police officer is a serial killer. With help from three friends, Davey launches a daring investigation that soon turns dangerous.

programme.title: Silent Night Bloody Night
programme.desc: A man investigates the grisly crimes that occurred in a former insane asylum, unsettling the locals who all seem to have something to hide.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre: Frankenstein's Castle of Freaks
programme.desc: The Mistress of the Dark presents a kinky 1974 version of the gothic tale set inside the good doctor’s lair as he reanimates a lynched Neanderthal.

programme.title: The Slumber Party Massacre
programme.desc: Trish's slumber party for her basketball teammates includes an unexpected guest.

programme.title: Uninvited
programme.desc: When a mutated cat escapes a lab study, it becomes the unlikely foil to a shady businessman’s banking scam aboard a yacht headed to the Caribbean.

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: Sorority sisters are as good as dead when they're stalked by a psychopathic stranger over the Christmas holiday in this influential slasher.

programme.title: Mortuary
programme.desc: Christie Parson suspects her father’s recent drowning was no accident but, as she gets closer to the truth, she discovers a darker secret.

programme.title: The Nest
programme.desc: The quiet town of North Port is being overrun by cockroaches, and its sheriff is pinning the blame on the INTEC Corporation’s genetic experiments.

programme.title: Creepshow III
programme.desc: Macabre tales center on a strange radio, a killer call girl, a haunting, and more in this third installment in an iconic horror anthology series.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Deadcon
programme.desc: A group of young celebrities must unravel the mystery behind a vengeful spirit at the biggest digital event of the year, Viewcon.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Plan 9 From Outer Space
programme.desc: Residents of California's San Fernando Valley are under attack by flying saucers from outer space. The aliens, led by Eros (Dudley Manlove) and his assistant, Tanna (Joanna Lee), intend to conquer the planet by resurrecting corpses in a Hollywood cemetery. The living dead -- a cape-wearing ghoul (Bela Lugosi), a vampire (Vampira) and a slow-footed cop (Tor Johnson) who was killed for his nosiness -- stalk curious humans who wander into the cemetery looking for evidence of the UFOs.

programme.title: Elvira's Movie Macabre

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This show celebrates the arrival of the holiday season. At Longmeadow, Monty ensures that there will be late summer colour by propagating some his favourites from the fantastically diverse salvia family. He also divides irises and reveals what has gone wrong with his onion crop. Joe finds seasonal inspiration at historic Newby Hall in North Yorkshire, home to the longest herbaceous borders in Europe.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Toby Buckland visits the RHS garden at Hyde Hall in Essex for ideas on creating and planting a dry garden, while Carol Klein shows her gardening students how to collect seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don unveils his plans for a wet meadow. He starts by planting herbaceous perennials that will thrive in heavy soils and also look good amidst the long grass. He also pots-on his salvia cuttings and explains the benefits of planting `green manure' in the veg patch. Now that he has harvested his potatoes, that is exactly what he is doing to boost the fertility of the soil for next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets going with some autumn garden maintenance whilst looking back over the year and reviewing his borders - which plants have done well and others that haven't. As he clears annuals that are past their best he plans a colourful display for late spring by planting up the garden with tulips. Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage continuing work on her new raised beds and taming an overgrown and unruly rambling rose.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In this Christmas edition, the team celebrate the festive season from a gardener's point of view. At Longmeadow, Monty and Rachel have a good clear up. Monty rejuvenates his rhubarb patch, introducing a local Herefordshire heritage variety apple tree to his orchard. Meanwhile, Carol discovers some of Britain's best winter walks and Rachel gets some tips on how to make beautiful Christmas decorations for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the official start of spring and Mothering Sunday only days away, Monty Don and the team look at the practical ways to achieve a better looking garden at this busy time of year. Monty is selecting and planting climbing roses at his garden in Herefordshire and gives plenty of advice on how to get them to thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the clocks move forward, the longer days of spring are welcomed by every gardener. It's a busy time in the garden and the longer daylight hours present a great opportunity to get on with larger gardening projects. Weather permitting, Joe will join Monty in his garden to get to grips with lining his newly created pond giving plenty of advice for anyone wanting to use water in the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing apace, Monty shows us how we can take advantage of the new growth of all sorts of perennials, and begins by taking cuttings from emerging Delphiniums in his border and also from a pot grown plant. He also demonstrates the best way of planting Clematis against a wall to ensure a profusion of summer flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's Easter and the biggest gardening weekend of the year. The team give plenty of advice and inspiration - from large projects to tackling weeds. At Longmeadow, Monty is getting started on the vegetable plot, where he recommends a palette of potatoes for delicious summer crops. He also returns to his newly created pond, where he is showing how to conceal the liner with an attractive edge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The successes and failures of all our gardens begin with the humble seed. This show is packed with know-how about how to sow a seed and ideas about how you could improve your garden this summer. Monty starts by sowing tender vegetables like cucumbers and courgettes which, from unpromising beginnings, will provide a fruitful summer. Plus, Carol gives a masterclass on successful seed sowing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: If you have a shady spot in your garden which is bereft of flowers, then Monty Don has some great suggestions of stalwarts which not only thrive in those tricky conditions, but return year after year. He is also working in the vegetable plot giving his tips on what to sow and plant out now. Meanwhile, Carol Klein discovers the pulmonaria, growing prolifically in the woodlands and verges of the New Forest.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we turkey hunt here in southwest Mississippi with Cragg Fitz from Trained Assassins TV. It's the opening week of turkey season in Mississippi and the birds are gobbling and looking for love. They whip us on opening morning but we stumble upon one that afternoon and make our move and he makes his! You won't want to miss this episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Finding roaming perch on big mudflats can take time but using a presentation that can help “call” fish in from a distance can be the difference maker. A technique developed on open water situations, the drop-shot has its place for hardwater applications as well.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Main Lake Rocks humps are fish holding magnets during the winter months. Jigging the new Glass Buckshot Spoon from Northland proves to be deadly!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Major cold fronts can put fish in a slump and making the bite very difficult. But there are ways to combat these brutal conditions. Tyler and Sara share some mid-winter techniques for giant slabs!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Spring time walleyes are always on the move and trying to find them can be difficult as they seek out warm water and food. Choosing the perfect presentation that can be fished to cover water yet can be fished in a variety of ways is critical - the swim bait fits the bill!

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Highlighting guests Dalton Smith; Dalton coached Campbellsville University Kayak Bass Team. Fished high school in KY; Mark watched him as a youth angle. Dalton caught two 14lb+ bass on the same day once. The 23-year-old uprooted from his area to follow this dream full time in OH.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: The Direction TV's Annual Military Appreciation Episode. Two good friends, Thomas & Terry McWilliams, help to make this event take place. This episode is dedicated to our service men and women.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode Mark is excited to return to famous Sam Rayburn to fish with one of the legends of bass fishing, Tommy Martin; they'll discuss and capture some information on Tommy's career on this trip for the episode. Also will note that Mark fished a Bassmaster Open on the lake back in the early 2000's. Another interesting tidbit is that Mark was actually on Sam Rayburn fishing when the space shuttle blew up; he actually heard the explosion and felt the rumble.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Kenai River Sportfishing Association (KRSA) was founded 30 years ago by Bob Penney with a strong and clear mission: sustain the local King salmon population in order to preserve the Kenai’s status as the greatest sportfishing river in the world. Over the years the organization has grown, developing numerous conservation and sustainability projects to support the health of this one-of-a-kind waterway – several of which are explored in the film.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, the Friends of the Fox River (FOTFR) organization has been working to protect and restore the Fox River in Illinois and Wisconsin. Now led by Gary Swick and Jenni Kempf, FOTFR is still fighting for the Fox, organizing river cleanup events to remove tons of trash from the river basin and educating students by bringing them directly to the watershed.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Ride along with Wisconsin DNR Game Warden Jonathan Kaiser as he patrols the frozen waters of Lake Winnebago during the opening days of the state’s historic sturgeon spearing season.

programme.title: Julie Higgs Spearfishing
programme.desc: In the series premiere, Julie embarks on an exhilarating journey to Costa Rica alongside two enthusiastic friends. Determined to land a monster first yellowfin tuna, Julie pushes her limits—not only guiding her friends to hook their inaugural catch, but also aiming to surpass her personal best: a remarkable 180-pound yellowfin.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. programme.title: FinQuest

Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP meets up with bass tournament anglers Lenny DeVos and Dr. Bruce Tufts north of Kingston Ontario

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Spring time on Lake Simcoe can produce enormous Yellow Perch. JP dives into the how to's on this episode

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Silver KIngs

programme.title: Silver Kings

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors

programme.desc: In the series premiere, Julie embarks on an exhilarating journey to Costa Rica alongside two enthusiastic friends. Determined to land a monster first yellowfin tuna, Julie pushes her limits—not only guiding her friends to hook their inaugural catch, but also aiming to surpass her personal best: a remarkable 180-pound yellowfin.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Watch along as Brandon Branch chases yellowfin with the guys from Fishing Florida Charters!

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: In Today's episode, Brandon is going to be fishing with Larry from Save Crystal River. They will be targeting Redfish, Trout, and Bass.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Mark takes you to his home lake in Taylorsville, KY – Taylorsville Lake for some fall bassin’. Mark normally has a guest but with this being his final network filmed show he takes us us on a journey of telling how he got started and what he’s getting into.Mark’s outdoor career spurred from Taylorsville Lake and the show will wrap up there. You’ll also get a view from sponsors, guest and producers of the show of what its meant to them. And what an amazing fall day of bassin’.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we turkey hunt here in southwest Mississippi with Cragg Fitz from Trained Assassins TV. It's the opening week of turkey season in Mississippi and the birds are gobbling and looking for love. They whip us on opening morning but we stumble upon one that afternoon and make our move and he makes his! You won't want to miss this episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Finding roaming perch on big mudflats can take time but using a presentation that can help “call” fish in from a distance can be the difference maker. A technique developed on open water situations, the drop-shot has its place for hardwater applications as well.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Main Lake Rocks humps are fish holding magnets during the winter months. Jigging the new Glass Buckshot Spoon from Northland proves to be deadly!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Major cold fronts can put fish in a slump and making the bite very difficult. But there are ways to combat these brutal conditions. Tyler and Sara share some mid-winter techniques for giant slabs!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Spring time walleyes are always on the move and trying to find them can be difficult as they seek out warm water and food. Choosing the perfect presentation that can be fished to cover water yet can be fished in a variety of ways is critical - the swim bait fits the bill!

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins legendary Captains Donny Lange and Charlie Scoble offshore in Islamorada.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to North Dakota for his annual whitetail/mule deer hunt with good friend, Todd Fuller.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head to Texas for their annual hunt with the Nature’s Eye crew.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head home to North Dakota to chase geese, ducks, and pheasants.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson and Zach chase big honkers and mallards in a dry field in their back yard in Indiana.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Cameraman, Kyle gets behind the bow for a couple hunts in Kentucky and connects with his first buck in over 5 years.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson Wentz, Ryan Kelly, and DeForest Buckner shoot limits of doves in Indiana.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Part of our North Dakota crew joins us in Illinois to shoot green heads in The Land of Lincoln.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach Wentz hunts whitetails in North Dakota. What starts as a typical hunt turns into a spot and stalk hunt.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didn’t think so. Let’s discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This episode takes the crew to famous Lake Fork in Texas; although known for its great bass fishing, this episode Mark and Xavier will be looking to catch some giant crappie; Mark met Xavier at the Crappie Classic through a mutual relationship they hold with Jenko Fishing.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Highlighting guests Dalton Smith; Dalton coached Campbellsville University Kayak Bass Team. Fished high school in KY; Mark watched him as a youth angle. Dalton caught two 14lb+ bass on the same day once. The 23-year-old uprooted from his area to follow this dream full time in OH.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: The Direction TV's Annual Military Appreciation Episode. Two good friends, Thomas & Terry McWilliams, help to make this event take place. This episode is dedicated to our service men and women.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode Mark is excited to return to famous Sam Rayburn to fish with one of the legends of bass fishing, Tommy Martin; they'll discuss and capture some information on Tommy's career on this trip for the episode. Also will note that Mark fished a Bassmaster Open on the lake back in the early 2000's. Another interesting tidbit is that Mark was actually on Sam Rayburn fishing when the space shuttle blew up; he actually heard the explosion and felt the rumble.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: A collection of the fish that didn't make the cut for an episode, so they get their own episode.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Kenai River Sportfishing Association (KRSA) was founded 30 years ago by Bob Penney with a strong and clear mission: sustain the local King salmon population in order to preserve the Kenai’s status as the greatest sportfishing river in the world. Over the years the organization has grown, developing numerous conservation and sustainability projects to support the health of this one-of-a-kind waterway – several of which are explored in the film.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, the Friends of the Fox River (FOTFR) organization has been working to protect and restore the Fox River in Illinois and Wisconsin. Now led by Gary Swick and Jenni Kempf, FOTFR is still fighting for the Fox, organizing river cleanup events to remove tons of trash from the river basin and educating students by bringing them directly to the watershed.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Ride along with Wisconsin DNR Game Warden Jonathan Kaiser as he patrols the frozen waters of Lake Winnebago during the opening days of the state’s historic sturgeon spearing season.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: FinQuest
